data.name: AccessConnectionUIControl_BrowseFileTitle

data.value: The connection properties object must be of type OleDBAccessConnectionProperties.

data.value: No connection properties have been set.

data.value: Remo&ve

data.value: &Reset

data.name: DataConnectionDialog_CannotChangeSingleDataProvider
data.value: The selected data provider cannot be changed when there is only one data provider available.

data.name: DataConnectionDialog_CannotChangeSingleDataSource
data.value: The selected data source cannot be changed when there is only one data source available.

data.name: DataConnectionDialog_ChangeDataSourceTitle
data.value: Change Data Source

data.name: DataConnectionDialog_ShowDialogNotSupported
data.value: You cannot use the Form.ShowDialog() method to show the data connection dialog. Use DataConnectionDialog.Show() instead.

data.name: DataConnectionDialog_CannotModifyState
data.value: The data connection dialog state cannot be programmatically modified when the dialog is visible.

data.name: DataConnectionDialog_DataSourceNoAssociation
data.value: The selected data source has no association with this data provider.

data.name: DataConnectionDialog_DataSourceNotFound
data.value: The data source was not found.

data.name: DataConnectionDialog_NoDataProviderSelected
data.value: No data provider is currently selected.

data.name: DataConnectionDialog_NoDataProvidersForDataSource
data.value: The '{0}' data source has no association with any data providers.

data.name: DataConnectionDialog_NoDataSourceSelected
data.value: No data source is currently selected.

data.name: DataConnectionDialog_NoDataSourcesAvailable
data.value: No data sources are available.

data.name: DataConnectionDialog_NoHelpAvailable
data.value: No help is available in this context.

data.name: DataConnectionDialog_TestConnectionSucceeded
data.value: Test connection succeeded.

data.name: DataConnectionDialog_TestResults
data.value: Test results

data.name: DataProvider_Odbc
data.value: .NET Framework Data Provider for ODBC

data.name: DataProvider_Odbc_DataSource_Description
data.value: Use this selection to specify an ODBC user or system data source name to connect to an ODBC driver through the .NET Framework Data Provider for ODBC.

data.name: DataProvider_Odbc_Description
data.value: Use this data provider to connect to ODBC data sources.

data.name: DataProvider_Odbc_Short
data.value: ODBC

data.name: DataProvider_OleDB
data.value: .NET Framework Data Provider for OLE DB

data.name: DataProvider_OleDB_AccessDataSource_Description
data.value: Use this selection to connect to a Microsoft Access database file through the .NET Framework Data Provider for OLE DB.

data.name: DataProvider_OleDB_Description
data.value: Use this data provider to connect to OLE DB data sources.

data.name: DataProvider_OleDB_OracleDataSource_Description
data.value: Use this selection to connect to Oracle 7.3, 8i, 9i or 10g using the native MSDAORA provider through the .NET Framework Data Provider for OLE DB.

data.name: DataProvider_OleDB_Short
data.value: OLE DB

data.name: DataProvider_OleDB_SqlDataSource_Description
data.value: Use this selection to connect to Microsoft SQL Server 2000 or above using the .NET framework data provider for OLEDB.

data.name: DataProvider_Oracle
data.value: .NET Framework Data Provider for Oracle

data.name: DataProvider_Oracle_DataSource_Description
data.value:
Use this selection to connect to Oracle 7.3, 8i, 9i or 10g using the .NET Framework Data Provider for Oracle.
Using the .NET Framework Data Provider for Oracle is not recommended because it is being deprecated.

data.name: DataProvider_Oracle_Description
data.value:
Use this data provider to connect to Oracle 7.3, 8i, 9i or 10g.
Using the .NET Framework Data Provider for Oracle is not recommended because it is being deprecated.

data.name: DataProvider_Oracle_Short
data.value: OracleClient

data.name: DataProvider_Sql
data.value: .NET Framework Data Provider for SQL Server

data.name: DataProvider_Sql_DataSource_Description
data.value: Use this selection to connect to Microsoft SQL Server 2005 or above using the .NET Framework Data Provider for SQL Server.

data.name: DataProvider_Sql_Description
data.value: Use this data provider to connect to Microsoft SQL Server 2005 or above.

data.name: DataProvider_Sql_FileDataSource_Description
data.value: Use this selection to attach a database file to a local Microsoft SQL Server instance (including Microsoft SQL Express) using the .NET Framework Data Provider for SQL Server.

data.name: DataProvider_Sql_Short
data.value: SqlClient

data.name: DataSource_CannotChangeSingleDataProvider
data.value: The default data provider cannot be changed when there is only one data provider available.

data.name: DataSource_DataProviderNotFound
data.value: The data provider was not found.

data.name: DataSource_MicrosoftAccess
data.value: Microsoft Access Database File

data.value: Microsoft ODBC Data Source

data.name: DataSource_MicrosoftSqlServer
data.value: Microsoft SQL Server

data.name: DataSource_MicrosoftSqlServerFile
data.value: Microsoft SQL Server Database File

data.name: DataSource_Oracle
data.value: Oracle Database

data.name: DataSource_UnspecifiedDisplayName
data.value: <other>

data.name: OdbcConnectionUIControl_SQLAllocEnvFailed
data.value: Failed to allocate ODBC environment handle.

data.name: OdbcConnectionUIControl_SQLAllocConnectFailed
data.value: Failed to allocate ODBC connection handle.

data.name: OdbcConnectionUIControl_SQLDriverConnectFailed
data.value: Failed to call the ODBC driver connection utility.

data.name: OdbcConnectionUIControl_InvalidConnectionProperties
data.value: The connection properties object must be of type OdbcConnectionProperties.

data.name: OleDBAccessConnectionProperties_MustSpecifyDataSource
data.value: This connection cannot be tested because no database file has been specified.

data.name: OleDBConnectionUIControl_InvalidConnectionProperties
data.value: The connection properties object must be of type OleDBConnectionProperties.

data.name: OracleConnectionUIControl_InvalidConnectionProperties
data.value: The connection properties object must be of type OracleConnectionProperties or OleDBOracleConnectionProperties.

data.name: SqlConnectionProperties_MustSpecifyDataSource
data.value: This connection cannot be tested because no server name has been specified.

data.name: SqlConnectionProperties_UnsupportedSqlVersion
data.value: This server version is not supported. You must have Microsoft SQL Server 2005 or later.

data.name: SqlConnectionUIControl_BrowseFileDefaultExt
data.value: mdf

data.name: SqlConnectionUIControl_BrowseFileFilter
data.value: Microsoft SQL Server Databases (*.mdf)|*.mdf|All Files (*.*)|*.*

data.name: SqlConnectionUIControl_BrowseFileTitle
data.value: Select SQL Server Database File

data.name: SqlConnectionProperties_CannotTestNonExistentDatabase
data.value: This connection cannot be tested because the specified database does not exist or is not visible to the specified user.

data.name: SqlConnectionUIControl_InvalidConnectionProperties
data.value: The connection properties object must be of type SqlConnectionProperties or OleDBSqlConnectionProperties.

data.name: SqlFileConnectionProperties_CannotTestNonExistentMdf
data.value: This connection cannot be tested because the specified database file does not exist.

data.name: SqlFileConnectionProperties_NoFileSpecified
data.value: No database file was specified.

data.name: SqlFileConnectionProperties_TimeoutReasons
data.value: Common reasons for this problem include that the server is not installed, the service is not started or the server is upgrading your database. If an upgrade is in process, you will be able to connect to the database when the upgrade is complete.

data.name: SqlFileConnectionUIControl_InvalidConnectionProperties
data.value: The connection properties object must be of type SqlFileConnectionProperties.
